text: She had loved Byron, but she had betrayed him betrayed him not twice, as he had betrayed her, but again and again over a long span of time, fawning on his implacable wife, purveying to her in secret the unguarded letters he never suspected any eye but her own would see, feeding the stealthy fires of her animosity: and having betrayed him, she had grown to fear and almost to hate him.
handwritten_text: She had loved Byron, but she had betrayed him betrayed him not twice, as he had betrayed her, but again and again over a long span of time, fawning on his implacable wife, purveying to her in secret the unguarded letters he never suspected any eye but her own would see, feeding the stealthy fires of her animosity: and having betrayed him, she had grown to fear and almost to hate him.
